name: Tuner (fancy)
description: This algorithm provides four simultaneous tuners. It uses an autocorrelation pitch detection method which is fairly CPU heavy, but which provides reliable pitch detection for most signals. For simpler tones, you may prefer the "Tuner (simple)" algorithm. Microtuning via Scala or MTS is supported.
gui_description: The display shows the detected pitch of the active channels, as a MIDI note number and cents, and as a value in Hz. It also shows a bar which grows to the left or right depending on how flat or sharp the note is relative to the ‘true’ pitch of the detected note.

specifications.name: CPU_usage
specifications.description: Fairly CPU heavy due to autocorrelation pitch detection method

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: Sets the range of pitches which can be tracked. Set this appropriately for the lowest note that you need to tune.

parameters.name: Track_bias
parameters.description: An internal parameter of the pitch tracking algorithm, which can help it avoid errors of octave in some circumstances. The default value is recommended in most cases.

parameters.name: Env_threshold
parameters.description: Sets a signal threshold below which no attempt is made to track pitch.
